Ingredients.3: 2 medium lemons, zested and juiced, divided

Ingredients.4: 2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent roll dough (such as Pillsbury® Recipe Creations®), divided

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch dish with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray.

Directions.2: Mix 3 tablespoons sugar with 1/4 of the lemon zest; set aside.

Directions.3: Unroll one piece of crescent dough and press in the bottom of the prepared dish, stretching dough to the edges.

Directions.4: Mix lemon juice and remaining lemon zest in a large bowl. Add cream cheese and 1/2 cup white sugar; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Spread over the crescent dough in the pan.

Directions.5: Unroll the second piece of crescent dough and layer over the cream cheese mixture, gently stretching dough to the edges. Brush melted butter on top and sprinkle with reserved sugar-lemon zest mixture.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown, about 30 minutes.

Directions.7: Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes. Lift lemon bars from the baking dish using the foil; transfer to a cutting board. Cut into 24 squares, leaving bars on the foil. Lift the foil and transfer the bars back into the baking dish. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour.
